Former Puducherry chief minister Janakir.description: PUDUCHERRY: The mortal remains of former Puducherry chief minister R V Janakiraman, who passed away here on Monday after a prolonged illness, was laid to rest with full state honours and with 21-gun salute in his native village -- Alathur -- in Villupuram district of Tamil Nadu on Tuesday morning. The mortal remains of the DMK leader had been kept for public homage at his residence on the Ambour Salai here till 8am and was taken by road to his native village. A host of leaders, including DMK president M K Stalin and Puducherry chief minister V Narayanasamy, attended the funeral and paid homage to the departed soul. Later, speaking to reporters, Narayanasamy recalled the services of the late leader. He said Janakiraman, who hailed from a humble background, had worked hard to rise to prominence by becoming an MLA and minister and later the chief minister, serving the Union territory efficiently. Narayanasamy said Janakiraman, who joined the DMK at a young age, had a great admiration and respect for late DMK leader M Karunanidhi and his family, including his son Stalin. Narayanasamy said the late leader had not been active in politics for the past two years due to poor health. Janakiraman had been bed-ridden due to Parkinsonism, seizure disorder and a chronic kidney disease. He was admitted to Pondicherry Institute of Medical Sciences on June 2. His condition deteriorated at 12.30am on June 10. He passed away at 2.30am on the same day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati.    CONSTITUENCIES CONTENDERS   Chandrapur Union MoS Hansraj Ahir (BJP); Suresh Dhanorkar (Congress)   Baramati Kanchan Kul (BJP); Supriya Sule (Congress)   Jalna State BJP chief Raosaheb Danve BJP; Vilas Keshavrao Autade (Congress)   Akola Sanjay Dhotre (BJP); Hidayat Patel (Congress)   Bhiwandi Kapil Patil(BJP); Suresh Kashinath Taware (Congress)    Nagpur Union minister Nitin Gadkari (BJP)   Ahmednagar Sujay Vikhe Patil (BJP)   Dhule Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre (BJP)    Beed Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter Pritam (BJP); Bajrang Sonawane (NCP)   Sangli Sitting MP Sanjay Patil (BJP)    Mumbai North Central Poonam Mahajan (BJP)    Aurangabad Subhash Zambad (Congress)   Gadchiroli Ashok Nete (BJP)   Mumbai North Gopal Shetty (BJP)    Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Lateral entry list published by Centac.description: Puducherry: The Centralized admission committee (Centac) has published the provisional allotment list for lateral entry admission into diploma courses in polytechnic colleges for the residents of Union territory of Puducherry on its website www.centacpuducherry.in. The committee said the candidates can download their allotment orders from the dashboard using their login credentials from June 15. It directed them to join the respective colleges from June 17 to 20 (before 5pm). It also directed them to refer to the information brochure for fee details. There are 809 seats available for lateral entry admissions to diploma courses in six government polytechnic colleges in Puducherry, Karaikal, Mahe and Yanam. The committee received 418 applications for admissions and found 296 eligible candidates from Puducherry and 107 from other states eligible. It rejected the applications of 15 candidates. It allotted seats to 276 Puducherry candidates.tnn Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejasvi Surya.description: BENGALURU: From a boy who was groomed by late Union minister H N Ananth Kumar and Tejaswini Ananth Kumar to becoming the challenge to the family’s control over Bengaluru South segment, Tejasvi Surya has come a long way.While expressing his gratitude to Kumar and his family, Surya says he is a stark example of the BJP’s intent to infuse young and new blood. You were a surprise choice for Bengaluru South. Did you expect this development?While I had feelers that there was something like this going around, I was quite happily savouring pani puri with my friends. To be honest I was overwhelmed and started tweeting about this. I only feel gratitude towards the party, which is facing a crucial election and has decided to take risk by fielding a youngster in such a prestigious seat. At 28, will you be able to fill the shoes of Kumar?Filling the shoes of Ananth Kumar is a far fetched thing for he was so gigantic. I only pray to God to give me strength, sincerity and earnestness to honestly work for the people of this constituency so that one day in the eyes of the people I can match up to Kumar’s contribution to the constituency. On lack of political experience, I have a well oiled party organisational machinery to support me with senior leaders there to hand hold me. So what is this election going to be for you?Primarily it is an election for PM Narendra Modi’s aspirational India. It is about the promise of a new and young India and I am just an ambassador of the message of this new India. It is a reflection of party and Modi’s inclination of bringing in young blood. Tejaswini not getting the ticket is quite sensitive...Yes it is sensitive but even during her talk with the Karyakartas she told them that the it was time to show maturity. She has given her full support to me. But what is your personal opinion about Tejaswini missing the ticket?When her name was first finalised by the state leadership, it must be March 11, I was the first to extend my support to her and remember posting on social media that she was the most deserving candidate and a good choice from the constituency. But the party decided to field an ordinary karyakarta like me. It is a decision taken by big people and I am just a foot soldier obeying their diktat. I have always supported Tejaswini ma’am and was literally groomed by that family. I have no reason for acrimony. Statements by Karti Chidamabaram suggest that you are the Schutzstaffel of BJP, or the infamous SS of the Nazi Germany... Your tweets also suggest that your idealogical beliefs are in conflict with the “Sab Ka Saath Sab Ka Vikas” For Karti Chidambaram and others I will reply back to them in their own coin. The idealogical inclinations are not an issue for this election. The issue for the election today, is PM Modi’s promise of a new and superpower India. My only concern as on today is to ensure that Bangalore South elects the BJP with a massive margin so that we will strengthen Modi hands. Rest is immaterial. Is age an advantage or do you require time to project yourself as a leader?That the party leadership has reposed faith in me speaks for itself and the least minimum I can do is to live up to it and say I am capable enough as on today to take on these challenges. You must rise to the occasion and I will rise to it. On dynasty politics, considering you are a nephew of a sitting BJP MLA and PM Modi has gone on the offensive against the Congress on the issue of “Naamdar”...My candidature and my role and activity in politics has no connection to my uncle’s political life. I have an identity of my own and have worked very hard over years. My aspirations precedes his elections. If the party leadership thought I was a rise to another dynast, they would not have considered me at all. In Video:BJP announces 28-year-old Tejasvi Surya for Bengaluru South seatDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Priyanka Gandhi.description: RAE BARELI: In her scathing attack on BJP and Modi government, Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi said that Congress doesn't need any certificate from anyone to prove its nationalist feelings. "Ye brashtachar ki baat karnewale sabse bade brashta hain… kaam ki baat karte hain magar sabse bade nikamme hain… dharma ki baat karne wale sabse bada adharm kar rahe hain - dharm ka istemal kar rahe hain… saheedon ka istemal kar rahe hain - sirf rajinit ke liye (They are talking of acting against corruption but are corrupt themselves… they talk of work but are good for nothing… they talk of dharma (read duties) but indulge in adharma by defying its norms - they use religion and martyrs for political interests)," Priyanka stated in her closed door meeting with cadres on Thursday. The Congress leader hit out at BJP's strategy of playing the nationalist card. "We are Congress… we launched the freedom movement… gave our blood and sweat… braved British atrocities … we don't need any certificate to prove our nationalist feelings especially from the ones who apologised to the British at that time", asserted Priyanka, urging the workers to go to every household in their area and meet every voter. She directed the workers to apprise the voters that the 2019 Lok Sabha election was as important as the freedom movement. Infusing energy in them she said, "Don't be afraid of anything as this is a weak government. Only a weak government curbs the voice of the people, which is a crime in democracy." Priyanka asked the workers to stand up for their leader whose only dream is the progress of India and its people. "Rahul thinks of the people without any vested interest," Priyanka said citing the example of her conversation with Rahul on the issue of using self-help group women for campaigning. "When I proposed to him this idea, he simply denied… saying that I created the SHGs to empower women, not use them in any way," Priyanka said quoting her brother. The Congress general secretary told the workers that she was working on mission 2022. "We will, with your support, form the government in 2022. And once we come, we will stay here for long on the basis of our hard work," she said adding that the hard-workers would be adequately rewarded. Nipah test results likely today.description: PUDUCHERRY: The 53-year-old resident of Cuddalore district, who was admitted to the Jawaharlal institute of postgraduate medical education and research (Jipmer) here with symptoms akin to that of Nipah infection on Sunday continued to be in a critical state on Thursday. Jipmer sent the samples of the patient to the National institute of virology (NIP) in Pune on Tuesday for testing. The test results are expected on Friday. Presently the male patient is on ventilator support at the isolation ward in the institute. He had been working in Guruvayur in Kerala where one person tested positive for Nipah infection. Meanwhile, the directorate of health and family welfare has made all necessary arrangements to prevent any outbreak of Nipah infection in the Union territory. It has deployed teams of (Indian Red Cross Society IRCS) volunteers at bus stands and railway stations to identify sick travellers from high-risk areas of Kerala viz., Thrissur, Kollam, Ernakulam and Idukki districts and admit them to the isolation facility at the government hospital for chest diseases (GHCD) where a dedicated team from Indira Gandhi medical college and research institute (IGMC & RI) will screen the patients for Nipah virus. The team will refer patients requiring intensive intervention to Jipmer, which will extend diagnostic support for lab confirmation of suspected cases with Nipah infection including logistic support to transport samples to NIP and receiving the test results. The IRCS volunteers have been advising homecare under isolation for sick travellers, who are not suspected of Nipah infection. The directorate also instructed all the private medical colleges to equip themselves with necessary facilities including isolation wards with beds exclusively to treat patients suspected with Nipah infection. It has identified the head of the department of medicine of the Indira Gandhi government general hospital and postgraduate institute as the nodal officer for Nipah. It has directed both government and private tertiary care hospitals to send daily notification of acute encephalitis syndrome (AES) cases to the integrated disease surveillance project (IDSP). The directorate earlier convened a meeting of the heads of the institutions and heads of the department of medicine from IGMC & RI, Rajiv Gandhi government women and children hospital and Jipmer to review the preparedness and prevention of outbreak of Nipah infection in Puducherry. Photos: Puducherry Lt Governor Kiran Bed.description: PUDUCHERRY: Puducherry Lt Governor Kiran Bedi joined hundreds of devotees in pulling the chariot of Tirukameeswarar temple at a village near here on the occasion of the annual car festival Thursday. This morning...Temple CAR Festival, VILLIIANUR, along with Honble Minister, Namassivayam and others. https://t.co/1Jkzow4gle— Kiran Bedi (@thekiranbedi) 1560397086000Bedi pulled the chariot amidst chanting of hymns by devotees at the 12th century temple in Villianur. Chief Minister V Narayanaswamy, Ministers A Namassivayam and M Kandasamy, newly-elected Member of Parliament V Vaithilingam and legislators were among those who participated in the festival. The temple is among the ancient shrines in Puducherry and as per tradition, the Head of the State should drag the chariot on the occasion of the car festival. BJP Candidate List.description: NEW DELHI: Amid rumblings over ticket denials in some seats like Kanpur, where saffron veteran   Murli Manohar Joshi has been benched   , and Bangalore South, where the wife of late party leader Ananth Kumar was overlooked for a young debutant, BJP issued on Tuesday a list of 43 nominees for the Lok Sabha polls. Not budging in the face of Joshi’s stiff resistance to being asked to step aside, BJP announced Satyadev Pachauri, a minister in the UP cabinet, as the replacement for the octogenarian leader. The list of 30 candidates for UP, however, accommodated women and child welfare minister Maneka Gandhi and her son Varun Gandhi, who were allowed to swap their Pilibhit and Sultanpur seats. Other interesting picks include   actor-politician Jaya Prada   , who was named against SP leader Azam Khan from Rampur in UP soon after she joined BJP. The selection ignites an old and bitter rivalry, as the former Bollywood star is close to former SP leader Amar Singh who has scores to settle with SP and Khan. Another UP cabinet minister, Rita Bahuguna Joshi, a former UP Congress chief who joined BJP, will contest from the prestigious constituency of Allahabad, where the sitting party MP, Shyama Charab Gupta, has left for SP and is contesting from Banda. She is the daughter of the late H N Bahuguna, a former UP chief minister and well-known Congress leader. Law minister Ravi Shankar Prasad, the party’s candidate from Patna Sahib, faced protests when he landed in Patna on Tuesday. The protesters claimed loyalty to BJP’s Rajya Sabha MP R K Sinha, who was later pulled up by the party while sources said the heckling was led by a person identified as an expelled BJP member. Varun Gandhi, who has had his ups and downs in BJP, was on the list of nominees and will stake his claim for Pilibhit, which has been a family bastion. Maneka Gandhi will be pitted in a triangular contest against SP-BSP alliance candidate Chandrabhanu Singh, alias Sonu Singh, a local politician with clout among Rajput voters who could have turned up the heat for Varun. Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh is in the fray as the Congress nominee. Joshi, a former BJP president, made no secret of his displeasure at being denied a ticket and went public by releasing a letter addressed to voters of Kanpur saying he received a call from party general secretary (organisation) Ramlal asking him not to contest the polls. Joshi, 85, has been asked not to contest just as it was decided that 91-year-old party patriarch L K Advani will not fight from Gandhinagar. Joshi’s defiant note was possibly the reason behind the nomination of a Brahmin face as another UP state minister, Satish Mahana, had been talked of as the frontrunner to replace the veteran leader The party decision is in line with several veterans not being nominated to pave way for younger leaders. The 2019 election will see the curtain drop on the electoral politics of what was seen the Vajpayee-Advani era in the party. BJP has also not given tickets to B C Khanduri, Karia Munda, Kalraj Mishra, Bijoya Chakravarty — all MPs for several terms and over 80 years of age. BJP sprang a surprise by giving 28-year-old Tejaswi Surya, an advocate and Karnataka Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha general secretary, the ticket from Bangalore South, belying expectations that Tejaswini Ananth Kumar would be its choice for the constituency her husband represented six times. The choice triggered strong protests and even state BJP president B S Yeddyurappa said they had sent only Tejaswini’s name, which, he claimed, was changed in Delhi. Tejaswini had to issue statements to mollify her supporters as she said the polls were about re-electing Narendra Modi as Prime Minister. BJP has announced 349 candidates, including 62 in UP, so far. Two seats in UP have been left for alliance partner Apna Dal (Sonelal). Party president Amit Shah will decide the remaining 16 seats in UP where sitting MPs are likely to be replaced, and a reason behind delaying the announcement is to reduce prospects of dissidence and rebellion. The party has so far dropped 14 sitting MPs in UP. BJP general secretary Arun Singh announced that Union minister Manoj Sinha has been fielded from Ghazipur, a seat he had won in 2014. BJP’s Kisan Morcha chief Birendra Singh Mast has been shifted from his sitting seat Bhadohi to far-east Ballia in UP, replacing sitting MP Bharat Singh, whose poor performance was a concern for the party. Agra MP Ram Shankar Katheria, head of the SC commission who had been denied renomination from the current seat, has been moved to Etawah (SC), replacing Ashok Kumar Dohray. UP BJP president Mahendra Nath Pandey has been repeated from Chandauli. In Video:No Murli Manohar Joshi in BJP list of 43Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Tiruvannamalai collector allots free hou.description: TIRUVANNAMALAI: Days after a 45-year-old man from the Irula community was rescued, Tiruvannamalai collector K S Kandasamy on Sunday allotted a free government house to him.  The man, Murugan, was allegedly abused and ill treated by a sugarcane contractor after confining him at Kengampatti village in Tuticorin district. Murugan and his family, including his wife Selvi, 40, and younger son Muniyappan, 20, lived at Reddikuppam Irula Colony near Vandhavasi. They took an advance of Rs 27,000 from a broker named Sakthivel, on the condition that they will repay the the money by working under a sugarcane contractor. Despite toiling long hours at the farm, the contractor told them recently that only Rs 9,000 of the advance had been paid off so far and they must work for two more years to settle the remaining Rs 18,000. The family feared that they would die due to the workload, and managed to escape from the farm. They reached their native village on May 28. However, the contractor, Sundar Raman, along with his accomplices, came to Reddikuppam village and abducted Murugan. Based on a TOI report, Tiruvannamalai collector conducted an inquiry with Murugan’s son Muniyappan on June 4. Murugan was rescued with the help of Tuticorin district administration officials on the same day. On Sunday, the collector met Murugan at Cheyyar revenue office had handed over the order to allot a free house worth Rs 2.60 lakh to his. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Medical services affected as doctors boy.description: PUDUCHERRY: The medical services at the outpatients departments and operation theatres in Jawaharlal Institute of Postgraduate Medical Education and Research, government and private medical college and hospitals in Union territory were hit as hundreds of doctors boycotted duty following a nation-wide strike by the Indian medical association (IMA) to register their protest on the attack on two doctors by a mob including the relatives of a deceased patient at a hospital in West Bengal. The medical students' network (MSN) of IMA called for a 24-hour nation-wide strike appealing to the doctors to boycott all elective services from 6am on Monday following which the doctors, resident doctors and interns at Jipmer, government and private medical colleges boycotted the academic activities and elective services from 6am on Monday. The resident doctors and interns and students of Jipmer staged a protest in front of the emergency medical services department on Monday. Jipmer IMA MSN led by national council member Suvrankar Datta submitted a memorandum to Jipmer dean and director urging them to initiate efforts to press the Centre and Union territory to pass the Central hospital and doctors' protection act and state ordinance for hospital and doctors' protection act immediately. "The horrific assault on the young doctors in NRS Medical College and Hospital, Kolkata and the subsequent attacks in the medical fraternity in West Bengal including stone pelting, injuring the eye of a young doctor, setting hostels on fire using petrol bombs and attacking women's hostels and political threats at multiple medical colleges in West Bengal have left every one of us shocked," said Datta in the memorandum. The interns at Mahatma Gandhi medical college and research institute, a constituent college of Sri Balaji Vidyapeeth, a deemed university, boycotted duty while the students boycotted classes on Monday. The resident doctors, interns and students of Indira Gandhi government medical college and research institute and Aarupadai Veedu medical college and hospital, a constituent college of Vinayaga Missions University staged demonstrations in front of the colleges. Only the causality wings in the two institutions functioned on Monday. The student council representatives and heads of the IMA MSNs from all colleges called on the Puducherry district collector and submitted a memorandum to him. By and large, all emergency services continued at Jipmer, government and private medical colleges. Students appearing for pre-university examinations have been exempted from participating in the strike. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\u2018Will act against officials if disc.description: Madurai: Departmental action will be taken against officials if found guilty in connection with the alleged discriminatory practices prevailing against scheduled caste people in S Valayapatti village who were attacked by members of an intermediate caste, said the vice-chairman of National Commission for Scheduled Castes L Murugan. The NCSC team visited S Valayapatti village along with officials from revenue and police department including district collector (in-charge) S Shantha Kumar on Saturday. When asked whether the transfer of two anganwadi workers belonging to scheduled caste based on pressure from intermediate caste members did not amount to encouraging discrimination, the vice-chairman said that was why he had issued showcause notice to the officials concerned. He had asked them to explain why legal action should not be initiated under the scheduled caste and scheduled tribe (prevention of atrocities) act against those responsible for shunting the anganwadi workers out of the village, he said. Murugan visited the affected people and took stock of the property damaged in the attack that took place on Sunday night. He insisted that the officials carry out speedy investigation and disburse compensation. Four people from scheduled castes had sustained injuries in the attack, which was the culmination point of the caste tension that has been prevailing there for about two years. Noted Sanskrit scholar Sambanda Sivachar.description: PUDUCHERRY: Noted Sanskrit scholar S Sambanda Sivacharyar, 92, a research assistant at the French Institute of Pondicherry (IFP), who was honoured by both French and Indian governments for his distinguished academic and scholarly work passed away due to age-related illness on Sunday at his native town Cuddalore, Tamil Nadu. Sambanda along with other scholars published several works including critical editions of Saivagamas, one of the 28 main texts (agamas) of Saivasiddantha (philosophy and scriptures of the Saivas) for the IFP and other institutions since 1950s. He along with others traced the historical evolution of the doctrines and the Saiva ritual system dating back several centuries. Joining IFP in 1969, he extensively toured various parts of Tamil Nadu, collected Saiva manuscripts on palm leaves and studied them under the guidance of Sanskrit scholar N R Bhatt. A well-trained master in reading old manuscripts in Tamil, Grantha, Telugu, Malayalam, Tigalari, Sarada, Nandinagari and Newari scripts, Sambanda was selected for the oldest and prestigious civil awards 'Ordre des Palmes Académiques' by the French Republic for his contributions in the study of the languages, texts, history and cultures of the Indian subcontinent in 2009. Five years later, the Indian government honoured him with the Presidential award of a certificate of honour for distinguished Sanskrit scholars in 2014. Born on January 6, 1927, in a family of temple priests, Sambanda learnt temple rites at the tender age of seven from his father and Veda mantras from eminent scholars before joining Ahobila Math Sanskrit Pathasala, Madurantakam. He studied at Raja's College, Tiruvaiyaru and Mylapore Sanskrit College and passed Mimamsa Sirumani with a gold medal. Before joining the IFP, he worked at Manuscript library of Adyar Theosophical Society and Government Manuscript library, Chennai and closely associated with the Tanjore Saraswathi Maham Library, Thiruvananthapuram and Manuscripts Library and Mysore Oriental Research Library in the 1950s. He has to his credit of establishing a printing press with Grantham and Devanagari scripts and printed and published many books on Agamas. IFP has one of the richest collections of palm leaf manuscripts on Saivasiddhanta in the world. The institute has more than 8,000 bundles of palm leaf manuscripts mostly on Saivasiddhanta followed by grammar, palmistry and Tevaram in various scripts. It has commenced categorising its collection and publishing critical editions. The institute's palm leaf manuscript collections have been included in the Unesco's Memory of the World Register. CM: Be ready for agitation against Kiran.description: PUDUCHERRY: Chief minister V Narayanasamy claimed that lieutenant governor Kiran Bedi has not stopped posing hindrances to the elected government and appealed to cadres of the Congress party and its allies to prepare themselves for a struggle against her. Speaking at the death anniversary observation of former chief minister V Venkatasubba Reddiar at the party office on Thursday, Narayanasamy accused Bedi of stalling all development works, projects to promote tourism and industries and generate employment of the elected government in the last two and half years. He recalled that the government could implement the free rice scheme and other projects only after a six-day sit-in strike led by him, his cabinet leaders and leaders of its allies in front Raj Nivas in February this year. He went on to claim that the landslide victory of Congress’ candidate V Vaithilingam in the Lok Sabha polls reflected the people’s rejection of Bedi's interference in the day-to-day affairs of the elected government. “And still lieutenant governor has not changed her approach,” Narayanasamy said. Stating that the elected government derives the strength from the leaders and cadres of Congress party and its allies, he said the government has been compelled to take an alternative course of action if Bedi continues to stall the projects introduced by the government. He was of the strong opinion that a lieutenant government must assist the government in securing more funds for the Union territory from the Centre and act in coordination with the government. “Lieutenant governor must not undertake inspections and convene meetings with the territorial officials to review various schemes,” he claimed. The Madras high court on April 30 declared that the Puducherry lieutenant governor cannot run a parallel government and cannot interfere with the day-to-day affairs of the elected government. The Union government filed an appeal before the Supreme Court against the Madras high court order. A vacation bench of the Supreme Court comprising Justices Indu Malhotra and M R Shah directed the Puducherry government not to implement any decisions having financial implications until June 21. The Puducherry cabinet, which will convene on June 7, has proposed to accord approval to a slew of projects that were rejected by the Union home ministry. Most of the projects have been proposed in Yanam, the territory’s enclave in Andhra Pradesh. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Fest to mark birth anniversary of Sankar.description: The department of art and culture and south zone cultural centre, Thanjavur will hold nine-day music. dance and theatre festival from June 14 to 22 at Gandhi Thidal on Beach Road to commemorate 152nd birth anniversary celebration of Sankaradas Swamigal, regarded as the father of Tamil theatre. Health minister Malladi Krishna Rao, who also holds the portfolio of art and culture, will inaugurate the festival in the presence of chief minister's parliamentary secretary K Lakshminarayanan at 6.30pm on June 14 at Gandhi Thidal on Beach Road. Government to observe 3-day mourning for.description: PUDUCHERRY: Former chief minister and DMK leader R V Janakiraman passed away in a private hospital here in the early hours of Monday after a prolonged old age-related illness. He was 78. He breathed his last at 2.30am at Pondicherry institute of medical sciences (Pims) where he was undergoing treatment. Janakiraman was admitted at Pims at 3am on June 2. He was bed-ridden for a prolonged period due to parkinsonism, seizure disorder and chronic kidney disease. His condition deteriorated at 12.30am on June 10 after he had profound hypotension. He passed away at 2.30am on the same day. Janakiraman’s body was kept at his residence on Gingee Salai for the public to pay homage until 7pm on Monday. The last rites will be held in his native village -- Alathur -- in Villupuram district of Tamil Nadu at 10am on Tuesday. DMK president M K Stalin, PMK founder-leader S Ramadoss, Puducherry lieutenant governor Kiran Bedi, chief minister V Narayanasamy and a host of Congress and DMK leaders condoled the death of Janakiraman. Narayanasamy said the late chief minister would be laid to rest with full state honours. The government will extend a state funeral to the departed leader.  The Puducherry government will observe state mourning for three days from June 10 as a mark of respect to the departed soul. There shall be no official entertainment during the period of state mourning and the national flag will be flown at half-mast for three days from June 10 through the Union territory of Puducherry. Stalin in his condolence message said late DMK leader M Karunanidhi honoured Janakiramnan with ‘Anna Award’ as early as in 2005. He said Janakiraman remained loyal to Karunanidhi and the party until his last breath and strived hard to develop the party in the Union territory. Ramadoss while condoling the death of the DMK leader recalled how Janikaraman despite hailing from a simple background worked hard to raise high in the political ladder and became the Puducherry chief minister. Bedi said Puducherry lost one of its veteran political leaders with the passing away of Janakiraman. "As chief minister of Puducherry and DMK party veteran leader, he was known for its astuteness in politics and administration. My deep condolences to the grieved family members and its followers," she said in the message. Janakiraman’ had served as Puducherry chief minister between 1996 and 2000. He was elected from Nellithope constituency for five consecutive terms (1985, 1990, 1991, 1996 and 2001). He lost to AIADMK candidate Om Sakthi Sekar in 2006 and 2011 assembly polls. After being diagnosed with parkinsonism, seizure disorder and chronic kidney disease, Janakiraman had not been active in the political sphere for the past few years. Beach in Puducherry selected for blue fl.description: PUDUCHERRY: The Union environment, forest and climate control ministry has proposed to seek ‘blue flag certification’ for at least one beach in each of the 13 coastal states and Union territories in the country under the World Bank-funded Integrated Coastal Zone Management Project (ICZMP). Blue flag certification is accorded by the Denmark-based Foundation for Environment Education (FEE) to the beaches that fulfil 33 stringent criteria for reducing existing pollution, managing solid waste and marine litter, adopting eco-friendly measures, improving seawater quality for bathing, enhancing safety and security measures and promoting tourism and allied initiatives among others. Once the beaches receive blue flag certification, FEE will mention them in its global headquarters. The tourists, who are familiar with blue flag certification and its standards, will plan their holidays in those countries. The ministry’s body – Society of integrated coastal management (Sicom) – in coordination with FEE launched a pilot coastal management project (Beams – Beach environment and aesthetics management services) to select beaches that can meet the requirements for blue flag certification in the country. The society after undertaking extensive fieldwork has selected 13 beaches including one in Puducherry (Eden in Chinna Veerampattinam) for the globally-applauded blue flag beach certification. The ministry launched a series of campaigns to realize the goal of attaining the eco-label for the selected beaches in the country. The campaign in Puducherry was formally launched during the world environment day celebrations on Wednesday. The initiatives include massive cleaning of the beach with eco-friendly tools and equipment, segregating and recycling of garbage and imparting environment education to members of the local communities, fishermen societies and school children. A team from the National centre for sustainable coastal management visited Puducherry a week ago and took seawater samples for checking the quality. The team also did a bathymetric survey to analyse under-seawater features and wave current and intensity. If the survey results meet the blue flag criterion, the ministry will earmark 500m-800m stretch of the beach and will establish an effective solid waste management system, watch tower with experienced lifeguards to save people from drowning, bathing facilities at international standards besides providing clean drinking water through a reverse osmosis plant and installing solar power generating units. The country has proposed to secure certification for 10 beaches in 2019-20. Shivrajpur (Dwarka in Gujarat) and Ghoghia (Daman & Diu) are ready for certification this season while four other beaches will be ready for certification by the next season. "The target is to develop at least 50 to 100 blue flag beaches in India in the next five years," said Sicom mission leader Sanjai Jalla. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Three children drown in lake.description: CUDDALORE: Three children who went to take bath in a lake near Bhuvanagiri in Cuddalore district drowned on Tuesday. Police said M Baranidaran, 9 his twin brother M Daranidaran and his neighbour and school mate B Poovarasan, 9, a Class 3 student of a government primary school in Bhuvanigiri were returning home from school, which reopened on Tuesday.  When they crossed Sathapadi Lake, they decided to bath in the waterbody. They deposited their school bags and uniforms on the bund of the lake and got into the lake. The three boys, who cannot swim, unknowingly reached a deep part of the lake and drowned. Their parents launched a hunt for them as they did not reach home after school hours. Their parents found their uniforms and school bags on the bund of the lake. They alerted the fire and rescue services personnel, who with the help of the local villagers recovered the bodies of the three children. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\u2018Direct Centre, state governments t.description: PUDUCHERRY: The Indian institute of community development has urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi to direct the Niti Ayog, which convenes on June 15, to examine whether the Union and state governments have fulfilled their ‘constitutional responsibilities’ of empowering the local bodies. The institute chairman V A Vasudevaraju in a letter addressed to Modi pointed out that the 73rd and 74th amendment of the Constitution in 1993 made grassroots-level planning mandatory and declared that the Union and state governments have ‘constitutional responsibilities’ of establishing a system for grassroots level planning. “But it was not given the serious attention it deserves by the (successive) governments…The Niti Ayog meeting on June 15 may examine the compliance of the Articles concerned (243 G, 243 I, 243 L 243 W, 243 ZD and 243 ZE) of the Constitution by the Union and state governments,”: he said in the letter. Article 243 G empowers village panchayats to prepare and implement plans for economic development and social justice while 243 I to constitute a finance commission to review its financial position and 243 L empowers panchayats in Union territories also to enjoy similar such powers. Article 243 W empowers municipalities to prepare and implement plans for economic development and social justice while 243 ZD empowers municipalities and panchayats to constitute a committee for district planning and 243 ZE empowers them to constitute a committee for metropolitan planning. “All the state governments may be requested to submit a factual statement on the above-mentioned matter to facilitate the future course of action to adhere to the constitutional mandate by the Union and state governments,” he said. He pointed out that the concept of ‘planning from below’ has been long-neglected for the past 70 years in the country. “Till 1993, it was not a constitutional issue. But after 1993 when Part IX and Part XI A were added to the Constitution by the 73rd and 74th amendments, ‘planning from below’ has become the ‘constitutional responsibilities’ of the Union and state governments,” he said. Bedi refutes Narayanasamy\u2019s charges.description: PUDUCHERRY: Lieutenant governor Kiran Bedi refuted the charges levelled by chief minister V Narayanasamy terming them as a ‘set of half-truths and total lies’. The chief minister accused Bedi of stalling the elected government’s development works and schemes and projects to promote tourism and industries and to generate more revenue. Bedi said her office works for the interest of the people ‘in letter and spirit’ and ‘within the framework of law and rules. “Public money is sacred. And it’s because of careful (approach) we have been able to save Puducherry from a debt trap last year. On the contrary, we for the first time spent according to our budget and within borrowing limits,” she said while brushing aside the chief minister’s charges. “We keep the focus on our work. But that does not mean misinformation is not rebutted and countered,” she added. She appealed to one and all to join her in ‘Puducherry green mission’. “Team Raj Nivas every weekend shall continue going to the chosen/identified place with its own seeds and saplings, and gardening implements to sow seeds or plant trees. All those who choose to join in are requested to come along with their own seeds or saplings and gardening implements to join in the ‘Green Puducherry’ Mission,” she said. Raj Nivas, which focused on making Puducherry prosperous in 2016, focused on ‘Swatch Puducherry’ in 2017, ‘water-rich Puducherry’ in 2018, has embarked on a mission to transform Puducherry into a green territory in 2019. “Tomorrow (Sunday) we begin ‘Mission Green Puducherry’ with planting trees at Kanagan Lake at 6am on the invitation and in partnership with residents of the area,” she said. Earlier Kiran Bedi resumed weekend rounds on Saturday and visited Kangan Lake . Lieutenant governor Kiran Bedi, who will turn 70 years on Sunday will offer special prayers at the temple on Raj Nivas premises at 9am. The prayers will be followed by the release of a book titled, 'Where kindness spoke' authored by Shivani Arora. Chief secretary Ashwani Kumar will release the book. Raj Nivas will be thrown open to the people and government servants between 11am and 1pm to greet the lieutenant governor on her birthday. “I dedicate my 70th birthday to Puducherry. I commit to make all my future weekend rounds along with Team Raj Nivas towards the cause of ‘Mission Green Puducherry’ by planting trees on the banks of water bodies, such as tanks, lakes, ponds and more.,” she said in a WhatsApp message. Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. Jipmer strike: No OPD, lab on Monday.description: PUDUCHERRY: The services at the outpatients’ department and laboratory in the Jawaharlal institute of postgraduate medical education and research (Jipmer) will be suspended on Monday as the Jipmer doctors’ association has served a strike notice to the administration. The elective surgeries scheduled on Monday will also be suspended due to the strike, according to a release from the institute. However, the institute will extend emergency medical services. The strike by the Jipmer doctors' association is to register their protest on the attack on duty doctors at a hospital in Kolkata. A group of people mostly the relatives of a deceased patient attacked young duty doctors Paribaha Mukherjee and Yash Tekwanu at the NRS medical college and hospital at Kolkata on June 10. The Jipmer resident doctors' association and Indian medical association's medical students' network staged a demonstration in front of emergency medical services on Friday to condemn the attack on the doctors. They also took out a rally to the administrative block and submitted a memorandum to Jipmer director Rakesh Aggarwal urging him to take appropriate initiatives to ensure the safety of the doctors in the institute. \u2018Get biometric attendance in govt o.description: Puducherry: Chief minister V Narayanasamy has directed the chief secretary Ashwani Kumar to initiate efforts for installing biometric attendance system in all government offices in the Union territory of Puducherry. Narayanasamy, who undertook a surprise inspection at the chief secretariat on Friday, noticed that a sizeable number of government servants did not reach office on time. Speaking to reporters he said the government servants have formed cartels among themselves to save latecomers claiming that they have sought permission earlier or have submitted leave letters. He said the government will initiate disciplinary action against government servants indulging in such practices and the latecomers. When the government servants go all-out to stage protests to establish their rights they must discharge their duty of serving the people, he said pointing out that inordinate delay in clearing the important files by them hampers the implementation of various schemes and projects of the government.  To a query on lieutenant governor Kiran Bedi’s reaction to his call for agitation as an attempt to provoke lawless behaviour, he questioned whether the chief minister did not have powers to hold a ‘peaceful’ protest. He claimed that the territorial officials have extended complete support to the government but Raj Nivas has been ‘returning the files’ posing several queries thereby delaying the implementation of several development projects in the territory. “Puducherry registered 11% growth as against national growth rate of 5.7%. The growth and development of Puducherry will be hampered if there are inordinate delays in getting approval for the projects,” he said. Narayanasamy said the government has been very keen on the growth of the territory and has evolved policies, schemes and projects to promote industries and tourism and to generate more revenue. “These schemes and projects must not be delayed, and the lieutenant governor must coordinate with the elected government for the growth of the territory,” he said. He pointed out that the recruitment of police constables and teachers and distribution of free rice were delayed by more than a year due to the interference of the lieutenant governor. Similarly, the government could not waive off farm loans due to Bedi’s interference. “We approached the Union home ministry and got approval for these schemes. We cannot be approaching the Union home ministry every now and then for every scheme or project. In the case between Delhi chief minister Kejriwal and lieutenant governor, the Supreme Court had declared that the lieutenant governor can refer only the rarest of the rare cases to the Union home ministry,” he claimed. Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. The constituencies reserved for SC candidates are Thiruvallur, Kancheepuram, Villupuram, Nilgiris, Chidambaram, Nagapattinam and Tenkasi in Tamil Nadu. | Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesIn the last Lok Sabha polls, AIADMK had a vote share of 44.3 per cent by winning 37 seats. BJP had a vote share of 5.5 per cent by winning just 1 seat, while NDA managed to win two seats with a vote share of 18.5 per cent PMK won one seat and had a vote share of 4.4 per cent. BJP (NDA) had an alliance with PMK. DMK was not able to win on any seat in the last Lok Sabha polls. In Lok Sabha elections 2019, DMK is contesting on 20 seats, while the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Two govt schools get Rs 99L worth smart.description: Tiruvannamalai: The state minister for HR&CE department Sevvoor S Ramachandran inaugurated two smart classrooms worth Rs 99 lakh rupees at two government schools at Arani on Tuesday .  Addressing the reporters after inaugurating the smart classrooms by lighting Kuthuvilakku(lamp) Ramachandran said that as many 326 students study at the government municipal high school located at Kannappa nagar and as many as 96 students pursue education at the Government Municipal middle school located at Subramaniya Sasthriyar Nagar in Arani town, the two schools which were equipped with smart classes.  The smart classes are aimed at enhancing the learning skills of government school students,the minister said. “We hope the facilities will bring a big transformation to the students of this school”he added.  Tiruvannamalai Chief education officer V Jayakumar , Arani RDO L Mythili , Arani Municipal commissioner K Ashok Kumar and various other education and revenue department officials participated in the inauguration ceremonies held at both the schools . Villupuram: Cops bust rave party, 16 hel.description: VILLUPURAM: Based on a tip, sleuths attached to the Villupuram district narcotics intelligence wing along with the Auroville police, busted a rave party at a cashew grove in Irumbai village on the wee hours of Sunday. Police detained R Yuvaraj, 36, of Manapakkam who was the organiser of the party. Based on his confession police arrested 16 more people, including Likath , Prabu , Ramachandran, who were in-charge of setting up the stage, disco lights and sound effects. Police seized Puducherry-made IMFL liquor and 125 grams of marijuana from the spot. Saravanan, inspector incharge of Auroville said, “After conducting a preliminary inquiry, we found that Yuvaraj had organized the rave party for his friend P Haji of Coimbatore and some of his close associates. Haji had also invited a few foreign nationals at the party.”  Some foreigners, including women, who had attended the party were released by the Auroville police after a warning. Saravanan said the Villupuram narcotics intelligence wing along with a team from Auroville police station reached the property of G Balaraman of Alangkuppam village around 11:30 pm. Police officials registered a case on 8 sections including 147 and 294a of IPC , 4(1)a and 4 (1)(i) Tamil Nadu Prohibition act and 3 (A) town nuisance act. On information Villupuram SP S Jayakumar came to the spot and conducted inquiry with the arrested. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Ex-MP to PM: Create exclusive fisheries.description: PUDUCHERRY: Former Lok Sabha MP M Ramadass has urged Prime Minister Narendra Modi to create a separate ministry for fishery resources and fishermen welfare and appoint a separate minister with independent charge if not a cabinet minister. In a letter to the Prime Minister, the former MP said most of members of the fishing community remain backward and poor leading a hand-to-mouth existence. He said 69% of the 15 million fishermen in the country live below the poverty line and dwell in unsanitary conditions without basic amenities. The community is affected every year by storms or droughts or incessant rain. They remain at the lowest rung of the social ladder. He said their level of literacy remains low and social and economic status lower than that of SCs and STs in many parts of the country. Their political representation in the parliament and assemblies remain low. He pointed out that the Mandal Commission suggested reserving constituencies for fishermen community and accord tribal status to them. He said the marine production of the country is 25% less than its potential. The marine production potential was pegged at 3.92 million tonnes whereas the actual output stood at 2.92 million tonnes. “Lack of infrastructure, inability to venture into deep sea fishing, high cost of fishing, intermittent natural hazards, environmental degradation including pollution and a host of other factors account for such a situation,” he said. He argued that 15 million fishermen dwelling in 3,288 marine fishing villages in nine maritime states and four Union territories and several other villages of inland waterways contribute a great deal to the socio-economic development of India. Their toil elevated India as the second largest producer of fish in the world. The total fish production in 2017-18 was estimated at 12.6 million tonnes, which is 6.3% of the global fish production. The sector exports 13.77 tonnes of 50 different fish varieties to 75 countries fetching a foreign exchange revenue of Rs 45,107 crore and provides employment to over 11 million people, he said. The long-deprived community and its occupation require special treatment like the SCs and STs, which can be accomplished only by an exclusive ministry, he said. Deposit Rs 1 lakh to consider candidatur.description: PUDUCHERRY: The Centralized Admission Committee (Centac) has received a series of complaints from various quarters that the students, who were allotted MBBS seats in Jawaharlal Institute of Postgraduate Medical Education and Research (Jipmer), do not opt out of MBBS counselling conducted by Centac and unnecessarily block MBBS seats in Puducherry government and private medical colleges in the Union territory. The committee has come out with a solution to resolve this issue. It will get the list of students allotted seats in Jipmer and will not consider them for admission even if they are eligible. It will consider their candidature only if they deposit Rs 1 lakh as caution deposit.  The caution deposit will be forfeited if the candidate fails to join within the prescribed date. “If any candidate who has been selected in Jipmer wants his/her name to be considered, then the candidate has to deposit Rs 1lakh as the cautionary deposit. This cautionary deposit will be forfeited if the candidate is allotted a seat by Centac and fails to join within the prescribed date,” read the information brochure for admission into undergraduate professional courses for the academic year 2019-20. Mamata Banerjee.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Projecting TDP supremo and AP chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu as a “national leader of importance” and keeping the debate on the alternate front prospects in the ensuing elections alive, West Bengal chief minister and Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee appealed to people of AP to elect TDP again to keep the duo of Narendra Modi and Amit Shah away from power. “Who is Modi to ask about our Prime Minister candidate? We will decide who to elect our leader as there will be alternative for Modi,” she pointed out. Mamata said Naidu has done a lot for development of Andhra Pradesh. “It’s a necessity for AP people to give the power to Naidu again as he will play a key role in national politics and show a path of development to the entire country,” she added. Addressing a public meeting convened by TDP on Sunday, Mamata said Naidu is the leader to take the country forward. “Like he has done in Andhra Pradesh, Naidu can do a lot in Delhi,” she said. Coming down heavily on Modi, Mamata appealed the gathering to save the country and remove Modi (desh ko bachana hai to Modi ko hatao). “Modi claimed to be chaiwala after 2014 elections. Now he says he is chowkidar,” she added. “But chowkidar for whom? For those who looted the country. Modi had claimed that demonitisation would mitigate terrorism and stop black money, but ironically the number of terrorist attacks was the highest in the past two years. Under Modi’s regime, more number of farmers committed suicide and unemployment increased.” She added that Modi failed to explain the Pulawama incident and the Rafale deal and spurned the demand for an all-party meeting on the issues. “The nation does not want leaders like Narendra Modi and Amit Shah,” she asserted, and challenged Modi for an open debate on a national channel of his choice to discuss issues facing the country. Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Week-long celebrations to mark internati.description: PUDUCHERRY: The Centre for yoga therapy, education and research (Cyter), a unit of Sri Balaji Vidyapeeth (SBV), a deemed university will hold a series of events from June 13 to 21 to commemorate the international yoga day celebrations on June 20 as per the guidelines of the University grants’ commission and Ayurveda, Yoga and Naturopathy, Unani, Siddha and Homoeopathy (Ayush) ministry. Cyter director and professor (yoga therapy) Ananda Balayogi Bhavanani said the centre will hold yoga awareness campaign for the patients at the Mahatma Gandhi medical college and research institute, a constitute college of SBV on June 13, a national seminar cum workshop on ‘Divyanga yoga yogic approach to address the special needs at the university in association with Kaivalyadhama Yoga Institute, International centre for yoga education and research, Samagra Shiksha, Satya Special School, Indian Yoga Association and Pondicherry Yogasana Association on June 14 and 15. It will also hold an awareness programme for children with special needs on June 17, mental health and wellbeing through yoga for the children with special needs on June 18, and a regional-level yogasana competition for students of the institutions imparting professional health education on June 20. The celebrations will conclude with a mass yoga demonstration at the promenade of Puducherry beach on June 21. SBV vice-chancellor S C Parija said yoga acquires great relevance, as it epitomizes the country’s spiritual value, heritage and code of conduct. “Cyter is a vibrant centre spearheading all-out efforts propelled towards fostering yoga therapy in all the three avenues expected of health sciences higher education institutions namely academics, research and patient care,” said Parija. Asaduddin Owaisi.description: NEW DELHI: Asaduddin Owaisi, president of All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen (AIMIM), was greeted with slogans of 'Jai Shri Ram', 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' and 'Vande Mataram' on Tuesday as he went on to take oath as a member of the 17th Lok Sabha here. Owaisi, a Member of Parliament (MP) from Hyderabad constituency, in response, said, "Jai Bheem, Jai Meem, Takbeer Allahu Akbar, Jai Hind" while concluding his oath. Later, responding to opposition's gesture, Owaisi told ANI, "I think, it's good that they remember such things after seeing me. I hope they remember our constitution and the deaths of children in Muzaffarpur as well. I will keep an eye on them." Besides, Aam Aadmi Party's (AAP) lone MP from Punjab's Sangrur, Bhagwant Mann, raised 'Inquilab Zindabad' slogans at the end of his oath-taking ceremony earlier today. #WATCH: Slogans of Bharat Mata ki Jai and Vande Mataram raised in the Lok Sabha as AIMIM MP from Hyderabad Asaduddi… https://t.co/6QTgnFYG6x— ANI (@ANI) 1560854690000This comes after BJP MP from Bhopal Pragya Singh Thakur ended her oath taking ceremony with 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' slogan on Monday. Subsequently, every BJP member continued to raise slogans. Moreover, chants of 'Jai Shri Ram' marked the oath-taking by minister Babual Supriyo, elected from Asansol in West Bengal, where the chanting of the slogan became a political issue during the recent elections. The furore over 'Jai Shri Ram' slogan started in the state after West Bengal chief minister Banerjee lost her cool when a group of men chanted 'Jai Shri Ram' as her convoy was passing through Bhatpara area in North 24 Parganas district earlier this month. BJP List 2019 WB.description: KOLKATA: The BJP in its first list of 28 candidates for West Bengal has pinned hopes on its veterans and defectors from the ruling Trinamool Congress to take on the Mamata Banerjee's government in the state. Of the 28 candidates, nearly 25 are new faces, with a thrust on active political workers rather than greenhorns from the glamour world. The saffron party, which bagged two Lok Sabha seats in the 2014 elections, is now targeting 23 of the state's 42 constituencies. BJP Lok Sabha first full listUnlike the TMC list, which had 18 new faces and a mix of both old-timers and greenhorns, hardcore politicians and personalities from the film industry, the BJP has put faith on its own leaders and defectors from other parties. There are four women candidates and one Muslim nominee in the first list. Of the candidates, five had recently defected to the saffron party from the Trinamool Congress and one from the CPI(M). West Bengal: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageUnion minister and BJP MP from Asansol Lok Sabha constituency Babul Supriyo has been renominated from the same seat and is pitted against actor Moon Moon Sen of the TMC. State BJP president Dilip Ghosh will contest from Medinipur seat against TMC leader Manas Bhunia. BJP national secretary Rahul Sinha will take on TMC heavyweight Sudip Bandopadhyay in Kolkata North Lok Sabha seat. State BJP vice-president and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose grandnephew, Chandra Kumar Bose will contest from Kolkata South Lok Sabha seat. Former IPS officer Bharati Ghosh, once known to be close to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, will be fighting against TMC candidate and actor Dipak Adhikary, popularly known as 'Dev', from Ghatal Lok Sabha constituency. The BJP has fielded former Trinamool Congress MLA Arjun Singh from Barrackpur Lok Sabha seat. Singh, who had recently joined the saffron party, has been pitted against TMCs Dinesh Trivedi. In Coochbebar Lok Sabha seat, the party has fielded former TMC youth leader Nishith Pramanik, while in Jadavpur Lok Sabha seat, expelled TMC MP Anupam Hazra will contest against TMC's Mimi Chakraborty, an actor by profession. Another former TMC MP Soumitra Khan, who joined the BJP in January, has been given ticket from Bishnupur(SC) Lok Sabha seat. Former CPI(M) MLA Khagen Murmu, who too had switched over to the BJP, will contest from Malda North seat and will take on TMCs Mausam Benazir Noor, who had recently defected to the party from the Congress, in Malda Uttar seat. The Lok Sabha elections in the state will be held from April 11 till May 19 in seven phases. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BHEL employees\u2019 union protest delay.description: VELLORE: Disappointed over delay in dispersal of the yearly plant performance bonus employees of Ranipet BHEL Boiler Auxiliaries Plant (BAP) staged a demonstration in front of the unit on Tuesday morning .  More than 120 employees attached to the BAP staff union took part in the demonstration demanding the release of bonus at the earliest .  Kandhan, secretary of BAP staff union, said , “every year the BHEL unit at Ranipet used to disperse a bonus based on the overall performance of the plant during the end of May after holding a high-level committee meeting with management, employees and union members. Meanwhile this year though we had shown a profit of 1,750 crore from all the 17 BHEL units across the nation , the management had not even initiated talks related to it , and more than 1200 employees of the Ranipet unit have been financially affected by it.  We are demanding that talks be initiated and the bonus money be dispersed at the earliest. We have staged a demonstration in front of the unit here for this reason. We hope that the management responds to ourdemands ” he said . Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Ushoshi Sengupta.description: KOLKATA: A gang of 10 bikers chased around Kolkata-based model Ushoshi Sengupta’s app cab through the streets of south Kolkata and harassed her — not once but twice — late on Monday night. The last round of harassment occurred after cops at a police station “refused to register her complaint” but, instead, referred her to the “right police station”.   Cops from Bhowanipore arrived around 10-15 minutes later. It was past midnight by then and Sengupta decided to pursue the case on Tuesday morning and requested the cabby to drop her colleague and her off at their homes. But the nightmare was far from being over. “The boys had followed us till my colleague’s house and, right when we were dropping him at Lake Gardens, six of them on three bikes came and stopped the car. They pelted stones, smashing the window. They then dragged me out and tried to break my phone to delete the video. Luckily, local people heard my cries for help and came out. The boys then fled,” Sengupta recalled.   She then called her father and sister; her own residence was just a lane away. They called cops, who came and asked her to file an FIR at the Charu Market police station. It was 1.30 a.m. when she reached there but, instead of taking down her complaint, the cops there directed her to Bhowanipore police station where the first assault had occured. “I just gave up and started shouting at this point. There was no female police officer. The officer there finally took down my complaint after asking a lot of questions but refused to take the cabby’s complaint, stating that two FIR could not be taken for the same incident,” she said. Frustrated and hapless, she returned home. It was at 2.30 p.m. on Tuesday that she posted the entire ordeal on Facebook along with a 20-second video clip. An additional CP later called Sengupta and assured her of strong action against not just the accused but an inquiry into police refusal to take her complaint citing jurisdiction issues. “The probe has just begun and we have identified all the culprits. More arrests are likely and we will probe whether there was lack of adequate response from cops,” said a Lalbazar official. The arrested were identified as Sheikh Rahit, Fardeen Khan, Sheikh Shabir Ali, Sheikh Gani, Sheikh Imran Ali, Sheikh Wasim and Atif Khan alias Md Samsad. A preliminary inquiry revealed the cab had accidentally brushed against the bike, causing the riders to lose balance. One of the bikes’ rear view mirrors broke and the youths accosted cabby Tarak Debnath to demand compensation. At least two more bikes and an auto carrying more people landed there, leading to the sequence of events ending with the assault at Lake Gardens, officials said. Cuddalore man tests negative for nipah v.description: PUDUCHERRY: The 52-year-old resident of Cuddalore district, who was admitted at the Jawaharlal institute of postgraduate medical education and research (Jipmer) here with flu symptoms akin to that of nipah infection, tested negative for nipah virus. The National Institute of Virology (NIV), Pune, which tested the samples of the patient sent by Jipmer declared that the patient has not been infected with nipah virus. NIV’s microbiology department, which received the samples of serum, endotracheal aspirate, CSF and urine of the patient on June 13, tested them and declared that the patient tested negative for Nipah infection. The patient identified as Natarajan from Cuddalore district, who was working in Guruvayur in Kerala where a patient tested positive for nipah infection was admitted to Jipmer in a semiconscious state on Sunday. His condition continues to be in a critical state as on Friday. He is on ventilator support at the isolation ward in the institute. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Applications invited for part-time diplo.description: Puducherry: The Centralized admission committee (Centac) has invited online applications for admission into part-time diploma courses in Motilal Nehru government polytechnic college from Monday. The candidates, who have cleared SSLC and with minimum two years’ work experience or cleared ITI (two years duration) with SSLC can apply for admission into part-time diploma courses. The candidates can submit the applications online by visiting www.centacpuducherry.in. The last date for submitting the application is June 24 (5pm). Om Birla.description: NEW DELHI: The BJP's surprise pick — Om Birla — is all set to become the next Lok Sabha Speaker after his candidature on Tuesday was backed by all NDA allies as also by the YSR Congress Party, the Biju Janata Dal and key opposition parties, including the Congress. A notice was given to the Lok Sabha Secretariat by the BJP, proposing the name of Birla, a two-time MP from Kota-Bundi seat in Rajasthan, for the Speaker's post and bringing a motion for his election, which will be held on Wednesday. As per sources, Prime Minister Narendra Modi proposed 57-year-old Birla's name for the post. The Rajasthan leader is considered to be close to both Modi and BJP president Amit Shah. 10 parties extend support to Om Birla's candidature for Lok Sabha speaker: Prahlad JoshiBirla's surprise nomination is seen by many in the BJP as a message from the top leadership that the party will promote leaders who keep a low-profile and work at the ground-level. BJD, YSRCP, JDU, Shiv Sena, Akali Dal, National People's Party, Mizo National Front, Lok Janshakti Party, AIADMK and Apna Dal have given the notice to support Birla's candidature for the Speaker's post, parliamentary affairs minister Pralhad Joshi told reporters. Later, Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said the party and the UPA allies have also decided to support the candidature of Birla as the Speaker. Chowdhury also said the Congress has already moved a motion supporting the ruling party candidate. The decision to support Birla's nomination was taken at a meeting of the UPA allies, where the leaders also discussed the opposition strategy during Parliament session. Birla won his first Lok Sabha election in 2014 and was re-elected from Rajasthan's Kota-Bundi seat. He defeated Congress's Ramnaraian Meena with a margin of over 2.5 lakh votes in the recently concluded general election. He has also been elected to Rajasthan assembly for three consecutive terms in 2003, 2008 and 2013. Birla will succeed eight-term MP Sumitra Mahajan as the Speaker, a post traditionally held by senior MPs. However, this will not be for the first time a relative newcomer will hold the position. In 1996, TDP leader G M C Balayogi was also a two-time MP when he was elected as the LS Speaker and after his death in a helicopter crash in 2002, Shiv Sena leader and the first-time MP Manohar Joshi was appointed to the position.
